Resources

The Combination of Urban Design and Planning Resources at the University of Washington.

Seminar

Actively attending seminars is an important part of PhD life. UW and its various colleges/departments have a long list of regular seminars related to urban design & planning. However, do not spend too much time on such diverse possibilities.

  • Urban Design & Planning Bi-weekly Research Seminar
  • Urban Design & Planning Ph.D. Student Colloquium
  • Statistics and Social Science (CS&SS) Seminar
  • UW eScience Data Science Seminar
  • Demography and Ecology (CSDE) Seminar Series
  • Human-Computer Interaction & Design (DUB) Seminar
  • Responsibility in AI Systems and Experiences (RAISE) Seminar
  • Change Seminar (Technology for Social Change)
  • Computing for the Environment Seminar
  • Clean Energy Seminar
  • Joint Seminar in Development Economics Series
  • Duck Family Environmental Politics Colloquium
  • PCC Current Research In Climate Science Seminar
  • Distinguished Lecture Series Computer Science & Engineering
  • Geography Colloquium
  • Department of Statistics Seminars
  • Graduate Seminars - Industrial & Systems Engineering

Computing and Software

  • Computing Resources
    • Hyak, the UW’s supercomputer, has had a powerful impact on supporting research at the UW.
    • Research Computing Club is a free source for students, funded by the STF at the University of Washington, to use the Hyak computing, and cloud services (Azure, AWS, etc.) resources through the Cloud Credit Program.
    • The Center for Studies in Demography and Ecology (CSDE) also provides computing resources.
    • The College of Built Environment also has one node of Hyak for CBE faculty and students.
    • You can get access to CBE remote computers and web servers as students.
  • Techniques and Software
    • Within the UW campus, use the Wi-Fi services and connect eduroam for Internet connection anywhere.
    • The Student Technology Loan Program allows you to borrow equipment such as laptops, cameras, and projections.
    • UW provides students with software such as Matlab, Overleaf, SPSS, and ArcGIS. The university or the college does not provide Adobe Suite, but you can use university computers or buy a student license.
    • UW provides Husky OnNet, VPN services for your travel outside of the campus.
  • Printing and Plotting
    • UW Libraries have printing services in multiple places across the campus.
    • CBE Digital Common has plotting and printing services.
    • Architectural Hall also has a plotting service that technically runs 24/7 by self-service. However, you will need the staff to load money to Archnet to do self-service printing.
